creator: helgrind
title: CheerLightbridge
materials_required: Entec DMX Pro USB to DMX adapter
description: This project revitalizes an existing art installation by connecting it to the Cheerlights IoT project. The installation uses a series of LED parcans controlled via DMX to display colors based on tweets sent to the #cheerlights hashtag. The goal is to integrate the installation into a global network of IoT devices that respond to real-time social media updates.
steps: Set up the hardware, including a Linux PC, LED parcans connected via DMX, and an Entec DMX Pro USB to DMX adapter.
Address the DMX devices manually using DIP switches or other addressing methods, setting a start address for each light.
Install Open Lighting Architecture (OLA) to manage the DMX output.
Configure OLA plugins to support Artnet and the Entec DMX Pro interface.
Create a new universe in OLA, selecting Artnet as the input interface and the Entec DMX Pro as the output.
Test the DMX output using the DMX console tab on the OLA web interface.
Install Node-RED, a visual data-flow programming environment, to handle Cheerlights updates.
Use an MQTT topic (mqtt://iot.eclipse.org with the topic cheerlights) in Node-RED to receive color updates from #cheerlights.
Implement code in Node-RED to convert the received color names into RGB values and send them to the Artnet output node.
Configure the Artnet output node in Node-RED to point to the OLA server.
Create a user interface in Node-RED with buttons and controls for blackout and fill functions, as well as color-picker controls to display the current state of the lights.
